column4: Any guitar players here?  What is the best, most compatible A/D capture device for Ubuntu?
there is no best app for anything
just take the output from your amp and whack it into the audio ni, you can then use something like audacious
i dont record, i just play but it's how I would. If you want low latency I'd install th rt kernel
remove the driver, reboot, then reinstall it
not sure, never bothered with it. Shouldn't as far as I am aware
I'm guessing you do a lot of sound production...
not really, you just choose the session at login
use the cog icon near your username
you select the lxde session in thelogin screen, you use the cog near your username
not the cog on the desktop
if it ain't broke, don't fix it :)
could wait for it to die then clean install / upgrade to Precise :)
